children.value: can be shown in the following example:
To achieve the above the following code needs do be inserted in your Markdown text.

props.code:
::ShDynamicTable
---
dataUrl: "http://dummyjson.com/users"
dataField: "users"
columns:
  - name: "firstName"
    title: "First Name"
    filter: false
    query: true
    sortable: true
    type: text
  - name: "lastName"
    title: "Last Name"
    filter: false
    query: true
    sortable: true
    type: text
  - name: "username"
    title: "username"
    filter: false
    query: true
    sortable: true
    type: text
  - name: "email"
    title: "Email"
    filter: false
    query: true
    sortable: false
    type: email
  - name: "gender"
    title: "Gender"
    filter: true
    sortable: true
    order: true
    type: text
  - name: "birthDate"
    title: "Birth Date"
    filter: false
    query: true
    sortable: true
    type: date
  - name: "age"
    title: "Age"
    filter: true
    query: true
    sortable: true
    type: number
ui:
  footer: "text-sm"
header: Dymanic Table example
footer: "*Copyright © 2024*"
---
::

children.value: from witch the data will be fetched. On the other hand,

represent
a list of elements where each table column is described.
Each column is described using the following properties:
- the label that will be show in the column header
- true | false value indication that if the field in question should be used for quick filters
- true | false value indicating if this filed should be used in query search
- true | false value indication if this field should be used for ordering the data
values defining the type of the field value

parameter can be used if the data fetched
holds the table items under a specific property.
This is typical in

results.
You can review the one used in

where the items that we would like to show in the
table is stored in
property in the component is a configuration object that allows customization of various styling aspects of the component. Each attribute within the
property targets a specific part of the component display, providing detailed control over its appearance and layout. Below is a detailed description of each attribute within the

component or constructor contains a
property

{

title: ListCards
description: This constructor is designed to showcase a list of cards, each represented by a component with associated properties. It provides a header section with a title, subtitle, and description, and dynamically renders the cards in a grid layout based on the provided settings and cardID.

children.value: This is the display format for the
constructor, designed to showcase its capabilities.

props.subtitle: Check out our latest projects
props.text: Here are some of the exciting projects we're working on.
props.title: Featured Projects

children.value: This is how it is constructed.

props.code:
::ShListCards
---
ui:
  gap: gap-6
description: This constructor is standalone
title: |
    Featured Projects
subtitle: |
    Check out our latest projects
text: |
    Here are some of the exciting projects we're working on.
cols: 2
cardID: [4, 2, 1]
---
::

children.value: Here are some of the exciting projects we're working on.
These are the properties and attributes associated to the
The constructor creates a display format for a list of cards, including a header section and a grid layout for the cards. Below is a detailed description of the properties and attributes used in the
constructor is a comprehensive configuration object that allows for the customization of various styling aspects of the list cards component. Each attribute within the
property targets a specific part of the list cards display, providing detailed control over its appearance and layout. Below is a detailed description of each attribute within the
Defines the overall styling for the container that holds the entire list of cards. This typically includes padding, margins, and general layout settings.
Styles applied to the header section, including the title, subtitle, and description. This can include font size, color, and alignment settings.
Define the style of title fonts, displayed prominently at the top of the header section.
Define the style of subtitle fonts, which provides additional context or description for the list of cards.
Define the style of text fonts
Styles applied to the grid layout of the cards. This typically includes grid columns and gap settings.
The gap size between the cards in the grid layout.
The title of the list of cards, displayed prominently at the top of the header section.
The subtitle, which provides additional context or description for the list of cards.
Additional descriptive text or instructions displayed below the subtitle.
The number of columns in the grid layout for the cards.
This prop allows this constructor to list cards in order that is inputed
This is used to help content writers. Doesn`t render on site.

props.:ui: {"header":"text-center mb-4","title":"text-4xl font-bold text-blue-600","subtitle":"text-2xl font-medium text-gray-700","text":"text-lg text-gray-600","base":"bg-gradient-to-b from-[#8FD2C4] rounded-2xl p-8","gap":"gap-6"}
props.subtitle: Check out the looks and feels
props.text: Feel free to explore any styling option using Tailwind classes!
props.title: Advanced Usage of this constuctor

children.value: This is an example with customized

props.code:
::ShListCards
---
ui:
  header: "text-center mb-4"
  title: "text-4xl font-bold text-blue-600"
  subtitle: "text-2xl font-medium text-gray-700"
  text: "text-lg text-gray-600"
  base: "bg-gradient-to-b from-[#8FD2C4] rounded-2xl p-8"
  gap: gap-6
cols: 3
title: |
    Advanced Usage of this constuctor
subtitle: |
    Check out the looks and feels
text: |
    Feel free to explore any styling option using Tailwind classes!
cardID: [4, 2, 1]
---
::

children.value: Check out the looks and feels
Feel free to explore any styling option using Tailwind classes!
